medium: Lacquer, acrylic gel, vinyl, cardboard, and wood
creditline: Museum purchase, Fowler McCormick, Class of 1921, Fund

makers.displaydate: born 1980, Raabs an der Thaya, Austria; active Vienna, Austria and Berlin, Germany
makers.displaymaker: Florian Schmidt, born 1980, Raabs an der Thaya, Austria; active Vienna, Austria and Berlin, Germany

texts.textentryhtml: To create works such as these, Schmidt combined scraps left over from the creation of larger pieces. Layers of paint cover their surfaces, alternately respecting and disobeying their prominent seams. The resulting works are hybrid objects—part painting, part assemblage, part sculpture. Displaying signs of wear and tear, they also privilege process over product. In these ways, the artist’s practice represents a contemporary interpretation and continuation of mid-century artworks that incorporated painterly abstraction, collage, and the repurposing of found materials, such as those by de Kooning, Rauschenberg, and Stella on view nearby.
Florian Schmidt, the artist, London, United Kingdom, consigned; to [Silverman, San Francisco, California], sold; to Princeton University Art Museum, 2011.
texts.remarks: as per invoice in curatorial file.AP.
